intro: Lachnaea greytonensis, commonly known as the Greyton lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lichenes. It is characterized by its foliose structure, with a thallus that is typically green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic alga and a fungal partner, enabling it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. It is often found on rock surfaces or soil in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in southern Africa.
